meanings.definition: A statement of money owed for goods or services provided.
meanings.sent1: I received a bill for my new shoes.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant gave us the bill after we finished our meal.
meanings.sent3: The bill for the ice cream was so high, I almost fainted!
meanings.sent4: The bill stared at me from the table, reminding me of my spending.
meanings.sent5: The bill glared at me, demanding to be paid immediately.

meanings.definition: A proposed law presented to a legislative body for consideration.
meanings.sent1: The senator introduced a bill to improve healthcare.
meanings.sent2: The bill on education reform was discussed in the parliament.
meanings.sent3: The bill to make ice cream mandatory was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The bill to ban homework seemed like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The bill to plant more trees was a step towards a greener future.

meanings.sent1: The bird used its bill to catch a worm.
meanings.sent2: The colorful bird had a long, curved bill.
meanings.sent3: The bird's bill looked like a sharp weapon ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The bill of the bird shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The bill of the bird was perfect for pecking at seeds.

meanings.definition: A written list of items or charges.
meanings.sent1: I made a bill of all the groceries we need to buy.
meanings.sent2: The bill included the cost of the repairs and parts.
meanings.sent3: The bill listed every single item we bought, even the snacks.
meanings.sent4: The bill of items seemed longer than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The bill of charges made me realize how much I spent.

meanings.sent1: I exchanged my bill for coins at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepted bills, not coins.
meanings.sent3: The bill was crumpled in my pocket, waiting to be spent.
meanings.sent4: The bill in my wallet was the last one I had left.
meanings.sent5: The bill felt crisp and new, untouched by hands.
